title: Creating a reading list of articles on information extraction (IE) from unstructured, noisy, or insufficient text sources involves selecting a mix of foundational papers, recent advancements, and specific applications. Here’s a list of 20 articles and papers that cover various aspects of IE up to 2022

author.particle: of Statistical Natural Language Processing" by

title: - A foundational text that covers many aspects of NLP, including IE
**"Information Extraction from Unstructured Text"** by Ralph Grishman
- A classic paper that provides an overview of early IE techniques
**"Open Information Extraction from the Web"** by Michele Banko et al
- Introduces Open IE, a method for extracting structured information from unstructured web data
**"Bootstrapping Named Entity Recognition with Automatically Generated Gazetteer Lists"** by David Nadeau et al
- Discusses methods for improving NER in noisy text
**"A Survey on Information Extraction for the Internet of Things"** by Zhe Liu et al
- Explores IE in the context of IoT, dealing with noisy and unstructured data
**"DeepDive: A Data Management System for Automatic Knowledge Base Construction"** by Ce Zhang et al
- Describes a system for extracting structured data from unstructured sources
**"Joint Extraction of Events and Entities within a Document Context"** by Lifu Huang et al
note: - Focuses on extracting events and entities simultaneously from text.

title: **"Neural Architectures for Named Entity Recognition"** by Guillaume Lample et al
- Introduces neural network models for NER, a key task in IE
**"A Survey on Recent Advances in Named Entity Recognition from Deep Learning models"** by Yadav and Bethard
note: - Reviews deep learning approaches to NER.

title: **"Extracting Structured Data from Web Pages"** by Yeye He et al
note: - Discusses techniques for extracting structured data from semi-structured web pages.

title: **"Information Extraction from Social Media: A Survey"** by Imran et al
- Surveys methods for extracting information from noisy social media data
**"Cross-lingual Information Extraction and Enrichment"** by Faruqui and Kumar
- Explores IE across different languages, dealing with noisy translations
**"A Survey on Relation Extraction"** by Pawar et al
- Provides an overview of techniques for extracting relationships between entities
**"Event Extraction from Text: A Survey"** by Chen et al
note: - Reviews methods for extracting events from unstructured text.

title: **"Information Extraction from Microblogs: A Survey"** by Dey et al
note: - Focuses on extracting information from short, noisy text like tweets.

title: **"Knowledge Graph Embedding: A Survey of Approaches and Applications"** by Wang et al
- Discusses embedding techniques for representing extracted information
**"Extracting Structured Information from User-Generated Content"** by Liu et al
- Explores methods for dealing with noisy user-generated content
**"A Survey on Deep Learning for Named Entity Recognition"** by Li et al
note: - Reviews deep learning models for NER, focusing on noisy data.

title: **"Information Extraction from Noisy Text"** by Gupta and Manning
- Discusses challenges and solutions for IE from noisy text sources
**"Open Information Extraction: The Second Generation"** by Mausam et al
- Describes advancements in Open IE techniques

These articles and papers provide a comprehensive overview of the field of information extraction, covering both foundational concepts and recent advancements in dealing with unstructured, noisy, or insufficient text sources
